definitions.definition: having a lot of influence on somebody/something
definitions.sensetop: influential in somethinginfluential in doing something

examples.text: His conversation with the manager was influential in his decision to join United.
She is one of the most influential figures in local politics.
The committee was influential in formulating government policy on employment.
The group was influential in setting up the new schools.
This was a highly influential work.
His ideas are widely influential among Palestinians.
We need to convince certain influential individuals within the community.

wordOrigin: late 16th cent. (referring to astral influence): from medieval Latin influentia ‘inflow’, from Latin influere, from in- ‘into’ + fluere ‘to flow’.
